com.mapbox.geojson

Class FlattenListOfPoints

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapbox.geojson.FlattenListOfPoints
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class FlattenListOfPoints
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A class that contains the required data to store a list of Points as a flat structure.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FlattenListOfPoints(double[] flattenLngLatPoints, double[] altitudes)

    • Constructor Detail

      • FlattenListOfPoints

        public FlattenListOfPoints(@NonNull
                           double[] flattenLngLatPoints,
                           @Nullable
                           double[] altitudes)
        Parameters:
        flattenLngLatPoints - A one-dimensional array coordinates: [lng1, lat1, lng2, lat2, ...]. It is stored as is, no copy or shifting is done.
        altitudes - An array of altitudes of each coordinate or Double.NaN if the coordinate does not have altitude. It is stored as is, no copy or shifting is done.

    • Method Detail

      • getFlattenLngLatArray

        @NonNull
public double[] getFlattenLngLatArray()
        Returns:
        a flatten array of all the coordinates (longitude, latitude): [lng1, lat1, lng2, lat2, ...].

      • getAltitudes

        @Nullable
public double[] getAltitudes()
        Returns:
        an array of all the altitudes (or null if no altitudes are present at all). If a coordinate does not contain altitude it's represented as Double.NaN

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the total number of points stored in this flattened structure.
        Returns:
        the total number of points.

      • points

        @NonNull
public java.util.List<Point> points()
        Creates a list of Points and returns it.

        If possible consider using getFlattenLngLatArray() and getAltitudes() instead.

        Returns:
        a list of Points
